pyeos_client package¶

Submodules¶

EOSChainApi module¶

class EOSChainApi.ChainAPI(connection_session)[source]¶

Bases: object

wrapper for EOS Chain API

abi_bin_to_json(data)[source]¶

Serialize back binary hex to json.

Parameters:data – (str) the format must be a string of a json

:return:response object

Example: 
>>> ChainAPI.abi_bin_to_json(data='{"code":"currency",
        "action":"transfer", "binargs":"000000008093dd74000000000094dd74e803000000000000"}')
{
  "args": {
    "from": "initb",
    "to": "initc",
    "quantity": 1000
  },
  "required_scope": [],
  "required_auth": []
}
abi_json_to_bin(data)[source]¶

Serialize json to binary hex. The resulting binary hex is usually used for the data field in push_transaction.

Parameters:data – (str) the format must be a string of a json
Returns:response object
Example: 
>>> ChainAPI.abi_json_to_bin(data='{"code":"currency",
        "action":"transfer", "args":{"from":"initb",
        "to":"initc", "quantity":1000}}')
{
  "binargs": "000000008093dd74000000000094dd74e803000000000000",
  "required_scope": [],
  "required_auth": []
}
get_account(account_name)[source]¶

Get information related to an account.

Parameters:account_name – (str) the format must be a string of a json
Returns:response object
Example: 
>>> ChainAPI.get_account(account_name='{"account_name":"inita"}')
{
  "name": "inita",
  "eos_balance": "999998.9574 EOS",
  "staked_balance": "0.0000 EOS",
  "unstaking_balance": "0.0000 EOS",
  "last_unstaking_time": "2106-02-07T06:28:15",
  "permissions": [
    {
      "name": "active",
      "parent": "owner",
      "required_auth": {
        "threshold": 1,
        "keys": [
          {
            "key": "EOS6MRyAjQq8ud7hVNYcfnVPJqcVpscN5SoV",
            "weight": 1
          }
        ],
        "accounts": []
      }
    },
    {
      "name": "owner",
      "parent": "owner",
      "required_auth": {
        "threshold": 1,
        "keys": [
          {
            "key": "EOS6MRyAjQq8ud7hVNYcfnVPJqcVpscN5So5CV",
            "weight": 1
          }
        ],
        "accounts": []
      }
    }
  ]
}
get_block(block_id)[source]¶

Get information related to a block.

Parameters:block_id – (str) the format must be a string of a json
Returns:response object
Example: 
>>> ChainAPI.get_block(block_id='{"block_num_or_id":5}')
{
  "previous": "0000000445a9f27898383fd7de32835d5d6a978cc14ce40d9f3jb",
  "timestamp": "2017-07-18T20:16:36",
  "transaction_merkle_root": "0000000000000000000000000000000000000",
  "producer": "initf",
  "producer_changes": [ ],
  "producer_signature": "204cb94b3186c3b4a7f88be4e9db9f8af2ffdb7ef9f",
  "cycles": [ ],
  "id":"000000050c0175cbf218a70131ddc3c3fab8b6e954edef77e0bfe7c36b599b1d",
  "block_num":5,
  "ref_block_prefix":27728114
}
get_code(account_name)[source]¶

Fetch smart contract code.

Parameters:account_name – (str) the format must be a string of a json
Returns:response object
Example: 
>>> ChainAPI.get_code(account_name='{"account_name":"currency"}')
{
  "name":"currency",
  "code_hash":"a1c8c84b4700c09c8edb83522237439e33cf01",
  "wast":"(module(type $0 (func (param i64 i64 i32) (result i32)))...truncated",
  "abi": {
  "types": [{
      "new_type_name": "account_name",
      "type": "name"
    }
  ],
  "structs": [{
      "name": "transfer",
      "base": "",
      "fields": [
        {"name":"from", "type":"account_name"},
        {"name":"to", "type":"account_name"},
        {"name":"quantity", "type":"uint64"}
      ]
    },{
      "name": "account",
      "base": "",
      "fields": [
        {"name":"key", "type":"name"},
        {"name":"balance", "type":"uint64"}
      ]
    }
  ],
  "actions": [{
      "name": "transfer",
      "type": "transfer"
    }
  ],
  "tables": [{
      "name": "account",
      "type": "account",
      "index_type": "i64",
      "key_names" : ["key"],
      "key_types" : ["name"]
    }
  ]
}
get_info()[source]¶

Get latest information related to a node.

Returns:response object
Example: 
>>> ChainAPI.get_info()
{
  "server_version": "b2eb1667",
  "head_block_num": 259590,
  "last_irreversible_block_num": 259573,
  "head_block_id": "0003f60677f3707f0704f16177bf5f007ebd45eb6efbb749f",
  "head_block_time": "2017-12-10T17:05:36",
  "head_block_producer": "initp",
  "recent_slots": "1111111111111111111111111111111111111111111111111",
  "participation_rate": "1.00000000000000000"
}
get_required_keys(transaction_data)[source]¶

Get required keys to sign a transaction from list of your keys.

Parameters:transaction_data – (str) transaction data with a list of keys,

the format must be a string of a json :return: response object

Example: 
>>> ChainAPI.get_required_keys(transaction_data='{"transaction": {"ref_block_num":"100","ref_block_prefix":"137469861","expiration":"2017-09-25T06:28:49","scope":["initb","initc"],"actions":[{"code":"currency","type":"transfer","recipients":["initb","initc"],"authorization":[{"account":"initb","permission":"active"}],"data":"000000000041934b000000008041934be803000000000000"}],"signatures":[],"authorizations":[]}, "available_keys":["EOS4toFS3YXEQCkuuw1aqDLrtHim86Gz9u3hBdcBw5KNPZcursVHq","EOS7d9A3uLe6As66jzN8j44TXJUqJSK3bFjjEEqR4oTvNAB3iM9SA","EOS6MRyAjQq8ud7hVNYcfnVPJqcVpscN5So8BhtHuGYqET5GDW5CV"]}')
 {
  "required_keys": [
    "EOS6MRyAjQq8ud7hVNYcfnVPJqcVpscN5So8BhtHuGYqET5GDW5CV"
  ]
}
get_table_rows(account_details)[source]¶

Fetch smart contract data from an account.

Parameters:account_details – (str) account details, the format

must be a string of a json :return: response object

Example: 
>>> ChainAPI.get_table_rows(account_details='{"scope":"inita",
        "code":"currency", "table":"account","json": true}')
{
  "rows": [
    {
      "account": "account",
      "balance": 1000
    }
  ],
  "more": false
}
push_transaction(transaction)[source]¶

This method expects a transaction in JSON format and will attempt to apply it to the blockchain,

Parameters:transaction – (str) transaction, the format must be a

string of a json :return: response object

Example: 
>>> ChainAPI.push_transaction(transaction='{"ref_block_num":"100","ref_block_prefix":"137469861","expiration":"2017-09-25T06:28:49","scope":["initb","initc"],"actions":[{"code":"currency","type":"transfer","recipients":["initb","initc"],"authorization":[{"account":"initb","permission":"active"}],"data":"000000000041934b000000008041934be803000000000000"}],"signatures":[],"authorizations":[]}')
{
  "args": {
    "from": "initb",
    "to": "initc",
    "quantity": 1000
  },
  "required_scope": [],
  "required_auth": []
}
push_transactions(transactions)[source]¶

This method push multiple transactions at once.

Parameters:transactions – (str) list of transactions, the format must be a

string of a list :return: response object

Example: 
>>> ChainAPI.push_transactions(transactions='[{"ref_block_num":"101","ref_block_prefix":"4159312339","expiration":"2017-09-25T06:28:49","scope":["initb","initc"],"actions":[{"code":"currency","type":"transfer","recipients":["initb","initc"],"authorization":[{"account":"initb","permission":"active"}],"data":"000000000041934b000000008041934be803000000000000"}],"signatures":[],"authorizations":[]}, {"ref_block_num":"101","ref_block_prefix":"4159312339","expiration":"2017-09-25T06:28:49","scope":["inita","initc"],"actions":[{"code":"currency","type":"transfer","recipients":["inita","initc"],"authorization":[{"account":"inita","permission":"active"}],"data":"000000008040934b000000008041934be803000000000000"}],"signatures":[],"authorizations":[]}]')
{
  "args": {
    "from": "initb",
    "to": "initc",
    "quantity": 1000
  },
  "required_scope": [],
  "required_auth": []
}

EOSWalletApi module¶

class EOSWalletApi.WalletAPI(connection_session)[source]¶

Bases: object

wrapper for EOS Wallet API

wallet_create(wallet_name)[source]¶

Create a new wallet with the given name.

Parameters:wallet_name – (str) name of the wallet to be created
Returns:response object
Example: 
>>> WalletAPI.wallet_create(wallet_name='"default"')
PW5KFWYKqvt63d4iNvedfDEPVZL227D3RQ1zpVFzuUwhMAJmRAYyX

This command will return the password that can be used to unlock the wallet in the future

wallet_get_public_keys()[source]¶

List all public keys across all wallets

Returns:response object
Example: 
>>> WalletAPI.wallet_get_public_keys()
["EOS6MRyAjQq8ud7hVNYcfnVPJqcVpscN5So8BhtHuGYqET5GDW5CV"]
wallet_import_key(wallet_name_privKey)[source]¶

Import a private key to the wallet of the given name

Parameters:wallet_name_privKey – (str) list that contains the wallet

name and private key :return: response object

Example: 
>>> WalletAPI.wallet_import_key(wallet_name_privKey='["default",
       "5KQwrPbwdL6PhXujxW37FSSQZ1JiwsST4cqQzDeyXtP79zkvFD3"]')
wallet_list()[source]¶

List all wallets

Returns:response object
Example: 
>>> WalletAPI.wallet_list()
["default *"]
wallet_list_keys()[source]¶

List all key pairs across all wallets

Returns:response object
Example: 
>>> WalletAPI.wallet_list_keys()
[["EOS6MRyAjQq8ud7hVNYcfnVPJqcVpscN5So8BhtHuGYqET5GDW5CV","5KQwrPbwdL6PhXujxW37FSSQZ1JiwsST4cqQzDeyXtP79zkvFD3"]]
wallet_lock(wallet_name)[source]¶

Lock a wallet of the given name

Parameters:wallet_name – (str) name of the wallet to be opened
Returns:response object
Example: 
>>> WalletAPI.wallet_lock(wallet_name='"default"')
{}
wallet_lock_all()[source]¶

Lock all wallets.

Returns:response object
Example: 
>>> WalletAPI.wallet_lock_all()
{}
wallet_open(wallet_name)[source]¶

Open an existing wallet of the given name.

Parameters:wallet_name – (str) name of the wallet to be opened
Returns:response object
Example: 
>>> WalletAPI.wallet_open(wallet_name='"default"')
{}
wallet_set_timeout(timeout)[source]¶

Set wallet auto lock timeout (in seconds)

Parameters:timeout – (str) timeout in seconds
Returns:response object
Example: 
>>> WalletAPI.wallet_set_timeout(timeout='10')
{}
wallet_sign_trx(transaction_data)[source]¶

Sign transaction given an array of transaction, require public keys, and chain id

Parameters:transaction_data – (str) list of transaction json and public key
Returns:response key
Example: 
>>> WalletAPI.wallet_sign_trx(transaction_data='[{"ref_block_num":21453,"ref_block_prefix":3165644999,"expiration":"2017-12-08T10:28:49","scope":["initb","initc"],"read_scope":[],"messages":[{"code":"currency","type":"transfer","authorization":[{"account":"initb","permission":"active"}],"data":"000000008093dd74000000000094dd74e803000000000000"}],"signatures":[]},["EOS6MRyAjQq8ud7hVNYcfnVPJqcVpscN5So8BhtHuGYqET5GDW5CV"],""]')
{
  "ref_block_num": 21453,
  "ref_block_prefix": 3165644999,
  "expiration": "2017-12-08T10:28:49",
  "scope": [
    "initb",
    "initc"
  ],
  "read_scope": [],
  "messages": [
    {
      "code": "currency",
      "type": "transfer",
      "authorization": [
        {
          "account": "initb",
          "permission": "active"
        }
      ],
      "data": "000000008093dd74000000000094dd74e803000000000000"
    }
  ],
  "signatures": [
    "1f393cc5ce6a6951fb53b11812345bcf14ffd978b07be386fd639eaf440bca7dca16b14833ec661ca0703d15e55a2a599a36d55ce78c4539433f6ce8bcee0158c3"
  ]
}
wallet_unlock(wallet_name_passord)[source]¶

Unlock a wallet with the given name and password

Parameters:wallet_name_passord – (str) list with name and password

of the given wallet :return: response object

Example: 
>>> WalletAPI.wallet_unlock(wallet_name_passord='["default",
       "PW5KFWYKqvt63d4iNvedfDEPVZL227D3RQ1zpVFzuUwhMAJmRAYyX"]')
{}

NodeosConnect module¶

response object
